description.narrative: The project intends to strengthen 120 communities under 8 Conventions. It was on-going 3 years project (2015-2017) funded by Bread for the World and Diakonia.  Start from 2016, Diakonia wants to focus on women empowerment and we funded it as a pilot project.  In 2018, this project becomes Diakonia's solely funded project implemented in 22 villages in Ayeyarwaddy and Magwe Regions.  The project aims to build the capacity of SHGs, village development committees especially women in VDCs and beneficiaries. Problem analysis: Poverty in Myanmar is unequally concentrated in rural areas, where poor people are relying on agricultural and casual employment for their livelihoods.  Women in rural areas face more challenges because of traditional customs and practices.  They have less opportunity in studying and rights.  There rarely see women in decision making level both in family and in community. Myanmar becomes one of the most vulnerable countries for disaster prone.  The climate change is one the root causes of emerging natural disaster alone the rural agriculture based communities.  The project aim to enhanced social and economic status of families in the targeted areas through women  empowerment Expected results of the project are: *Women bacame involved more in community development work as social change agents. *Women engaged more in produtive work. *Project staff effectively managed the project.  The project activities will emphasis on women empowerment by providing awareness raising on GBV, conflict, human right and environment. In addition, the project will conduct leadership skills training for VDC and women groups.  Technical skill trainings on micro credit, SME, agriculture, and livestock, vocational trainings will be conducted.  Exchange activities will be done.  There will be funding supports for individual woman and women group to set up income generating activities. Thematic focus of the project is gender and social economic justice.
This project mainly contributes to results within Economic empowerment of women. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
